sense.name: pick or pull out sharply to gather or remove
sense.examples: She plucked flowers in the garden. Please pluck the chickens for dinner tonight. The teacher plucked a pen from the case and started writing frantically. The hawk plucked the field mouse from the road.

sense.name: pull lightly but continuously as strings on an instrument
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] PLUCK NP2[patient[concrete]] Includes: PLUCK AT NOTE: Compare to sense 1. In this sense, the NP2 (thing being plucked) does not get removed from it's location.
sense.examples: The musician plucked the strings of his mandolin. Arrie plucked at the loose threads on her dress.

sense.name: buy or sell in an underhanded manner; overprice; rip off
sense.examples: Mark was a salesman who plucked you for all you had. The dealer plucked these designer bags off the streets of Prague.
